faq.title: Clear Answers, Expert Insights, Hassle Free Consulting Experience

items.question: Is physical presence a must to open a bank account in Dubai?
items.answer: To open a local bank in the UAE, a physical presence is required. However, if you plan to open a bank account with an international bank, you can get a financial advisor in the UAE to act as your representative.

items.question: What are the different types of bank accounts in the UAE?
items.answer: The country offers various types of bank accounts, including corporate, personal, and savings accounts. The choice depends on your unique personal or business financial needs.

items.question: Will my bank account be closed if I fail to renew my residency visa?
items.answer: No, your account will not be closed; rather, it will be converted to a non-resident savings account. Keep in mind that a restriction or closure may be set if you fail to communicate with the bank.

items.question: How long does it take to set up a bank account?
items.answer: Most bank accounts can be set up within 1 to 14 days; however, a corporate account can sometimes take a couple of months.

items.question: Can a foreign investor open a bank account in Dubai?
items.answer: Yes, expats can open their bank accounts in the city by submitting the appropriate documents and application, including a trade license, proof of business activities, passport copies, and a company profile.
